      • list

        public ListDevicesResult list(java.lang.Integer limit,
                              java.lang.String paginationToken)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Lists the devices attached to the user's account.
        Parameters:
        limit - the number of devices to return per page. Max allows by service is 60.
        paginationToken - the string returned by a previous list call to fetched the next page of results.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • list

        public void list(java.lang.Integer limit,
                 java.lang.String paginationToken,
                 Callback<ListDevicesResult> callback)
        Lists the devices attached to the user's account.
        Parameters:
        limit - the number of devices to return per page. Max allows by service is 60.
        paginationToken - the string returned by a previous list call to fetched the next page of results.

      • forget

        public void forget()
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Forget the current device. The device will no longer be tracked. Note: Calling updateStatus(boolean) after forget() will fail. The user needs to sign-out and sign-in again to be able to update the device status.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • forget

        public void forget(Callback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Forget the current device. The device will no longer be tracked. Note: Calling updateStatus(boolean) after forget() will fail. The user needs to sign-out and sign-in again to be able to update the device status.

      • forget

        public void forget(java.lang.String deviceKey)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Forget the device identified by the deviceKey. The device will no longer be tracked. Note: Calling updateStatus(boolean) after forget() will fail. The user needs to sign-out and sign-in again to be able to update the device status.
        Parameters:
        deviceKey - the device identifier
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • forget

        public void forget(java.lang.String deviceKey,
                   Callback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Forget the device identified by the deviceKey. The device will no longer be tracked. Note: Calling updateStatus(boolean) after forget() will fail. The user needs to sign-out and sign-in again to be able to update the device status.
        Parameters:
        deviceKey - the device identifier
